column4: is there anyone that can help pinpoint a wireless networking problem? Everything I'm looking for in terms of making sure the drivers are installed, the device is recognized, etc. seems ok, yet I'm still unable to get my wireless card connected to the network
it does not connect to my home network, but wifi-radar and iwlist does see the network
right now my wireless network is completely open, essid is broadcasting, no encryption, no mac restrictions
yes
I can see them, but not connect to them
what happens when you as root issues  iwlist wlan0  scan
when I do iwlist ath0 scanning I can see the wireless network
can you please prefix you responses with a nick so we know to whom you're responding to
sorry, will do on future responses
iwconfig ath0   what does that tell you?
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/9377/
now issue             dhclient
what did you get from that command dhclient ?
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/9378/
i'd disable those other interfaces temporarily until you get the wireless portion working
vmnet1 and vmnet8? What is the easiest way to disable them?
having that many interfaces will most likely get your system confused as to which is the correct gateway to use
so I can disable wifi0, vmnet1, and vmnet8 and just leave ath0 (wireless), eth0 (wired), and lo is that correct?
just leave lo and ath0 only

ok, that will require me to be disconnected from the internet temporarily to do that b/c I'm connected via eth0 now. Where should I disable those interfaces from? Is it just in the /etc/networking/interfaces file?
no, you have to google for this and find out where they will get disabled, i dont know off hand
ok, I'll do that. hopefully I'll be back soon, but either way, thanks for your help.
